results.definition: a quality of a given color that differs slightly from another color
the elastic tension of living muscles, arteries, etc. that facilitate response to stimuli
the general atmosphere of a place or situation and the effect that it has on people
examples: a clergyman improved the tone of the meeting

results.definition: a notation representing the pitch and duration of a musical sound
(music) the distinctive property of a complex sound (a voice or noise or musical sound)
examples: the muffled tones of the broken bell summoned them to meet

results.definition: a musical interval of two semitones
the quality of a person's voice
examples: he began in a conversational tone
he spoke in a nervous tone of voice

results.definition: vary the pitch of one's speech
utter monotonously and repetitively and rhythmically

examples: they tested his hearing with pure tones of different frequencies

results.definition: change the color or tone of
(linguistics) a pitch or change in pitch of the voice that serves to distinguish words in tonal languages
examples: the Beijing dialect uses four tones

results.definition: the quality of something (an act or a piece of writing) that reveals the attitudes and presuppositions of the author
examples: the general tone of articles appearing in the newspapers is that the government should withdraw
from the tone of her behavior I gathered that I had outstayed my welcome
